generalTextForBus.title: Schema Wizard Tours
generalTextForBus.message: Look for the tour icon (bus) on pages you visit for brief tours of those pages.

generalHelp.title: Schema Wizard Help
generalHelp.message:
General help is available by pressing this icon. Help icons throughout the application provide context sensitive help

This concludes the 'Catalog Tour'.

domainsMain.title: Catalog: Domains
domainsMain.message: Interpretations are one of the most important pieces in successfully finding semantic meaning for a field.This progressive analysis provides an interpretation that has significant semantic meaning that far exceeds simple syntactic recognition.

schemaMain.title: Catalog: Schemas
schemaMain.message:
This tabbed page lists existing domains and a button for creating a new one.
Domains are a set of interpretations which are managed by selecting a domain.

dataSampleMain.title: Catalog: Data Samples
dataSampleMain.message: This tabbed page lists files that have been used in the creation of schemas.

mainPageTour.title: Catalog Tour
mainPageTour.message:
Welcome to the 'Catalog Tour' of Schema Wizard. The catalog is composed of three different objects:
  • Schemas,
  • Data Samples, and
  • Domains
Lists of these objects and the means to manage them are found ontheir respective tabbed pages. Continue with the tour to take a brief look at each.

step1.title: Interpretations Tour
step1.message: Welcome to the 'Interpretation Tour' of Schema Wizard.Interpretations are one of the most important pieces in successfully finding semantic meaning for a field.This progressive analysis provides an interpretation that has significant semantic meaning that far exceeds simple syntactic recognition.

step2.title: Name the Interpretation
step2.message: Give your interpretation the appropriate name(minimum of two characters).

step3.title: Give the Interpretation a Description
step3.message: Give the Interpretation an informative description (minimum of 10 characters).

step4.title: Constraints
step4.message:
These constraints define valid values for the interpretation you created.
The Main-Type, and Detail-Type are required in order to properly complete analysis on the correct type.

step5.title: Validation Script Environment
step5.message: This is a Python Validation Script Environment, in which you have the ability to write scripts. Use this script to validate your interpretation.

step6.title: Test Data
step6.message: The test data is primarily used to test against the script created.

step7.title: Test Output
step7.message: This area is designed to Output whatever your script returns.

step8.title: Matching Names
step8.message: This allows any additional names to be considered for the interpretation created.

step9.title: Save and Exit
step9.message: After you have completed everything you need to have a valid interpretation you can save and exit, or create more interpretations.

step1.title: Inspecting Data Samples
step1.message:
Welcome to the Schema Wizard 'Inspect Samples' section.

 Inspecting the data samples that have been selected in order to create a schema is a crucial step as going through each data sample is important for efficient analysis on each file and discarding of unsuitable samples.

step2.title: Data Sample Details
step2.message:
This specifies the current data sample that you are inspecting and how many are left in the files that were uploaded.

 Inside of this panel, Schema Wizard has laid out each field that has been identified in your data sample and the correlating statistics, as well as any matching interpretations.

step3.title: Data Sample Analytics
step3.message: In this panel, it lists all of the analytics, as well as different graph options to view the data.

step4.title: Data Sample Legend
step4.message: In order to understand all of the fields in the data sample table, this legend explains the forms of analysis that have been executed and what they mean for the analysis of the data sample.

step5.title: Data Sample Interpretation
step5.message: Any of the interpretations created may have been matched to a field in the data sample.

step6.title: Data Sample Discards
step6.message: If the data sample that was uploaded was unsuitable, then clicking the 'Discard' button will get rid of this specific data sample

step7.title: Next Data Sample
step7.message: Once you have completed your analysis on the data sample clicking 'Next' will move you to the next data sample.

step1.title: Matching Fields Step
step1.message:
This step in Schema Wizard is crucial for seeing how all of your data sources matched to each other and all of the analytics that came out of the matching.

In this section you need to uses all of the analysis provided as well as visual tools to make sure the matching went as expected.

step2.title: Data Source Profile
step2.message: Based upon all of the matching done in the previous step, you know have all of your data samples here, as well as the matched fields that have been identified.

step3.title: Expand Data Sources
step3.message: Click on this button to see all of the fields across all of the data sources side-by-side.

step4.title: Remove Data Sample
step4.message: If you find a data sample is now unusable in this step, simply remove it.

step5.title: Remove Schema Field
step5.message: If one of the Schema properties is unusable, it can be removed

step6.title: Comparing Samples and Fields
step6.message: By clicking on the fields in a specific data sample, you can compare and use the visual tools to see their relevance

step7.title: Detail Panel 1
step7.message: In this first panel you can see what analysis has been completed on your data source field

step8.title: Detail Panel 2
step8.message: This second panel is useful for comparing fields of different data sources.

step9.title: Visual Tools
step9.message: Utilizing the visual tools may assist in analysis of data source fields

step10.title: Finalize Matching Fields
step10.message: Once you have completed your analysis, move onto 'Finalizing the Schema' by clicking 'Next'

step1.title: Finalize Schema
step1.message:
This is the final step when it comes to the creation of your schema
In this step you need to verify that all of the matchihng fields and thier attributes are propely matched

step2.title: Finalize Fields
step2.message: Here you can change the name of any field.

step3.title: Aliases
step3.message: If you change any of the Field names, they will be stored here as an 'Alias' to the field

step4.title: Add Field
step4.message: You have the option to add any additional fields to your schema if necessary

step5.title: Finalize Schema
step5.message:
By clicking 'Next' you will move onto the final step of Finalizing your schema by giving it a name, version, and description

 This concludes the Schema Creation Tour

step1.title: Welcome to this data sample in the catalog
step1.message: From here you are able to view a data sample that has been previously uploaded and view any statistics or graphs that correlate to the field in the sample
